page.title: 06HUNSHELF HALL
page.content: and was installed in 1983. Mr. Battye normally stocks 40 tons of fertilizer in his 40 years old barn. The breeding bull is 2 years old and weighs 650 kilos. There are 22 beef bulls of which the oldest is 9 months. In winter the cattle are brought inside and put into one of the 62 cubicles. Of all the breeds of cattle Mr. Battye's favourite is the breed of Fresians. {HUNSHELF HALL } Hunshelf Hall, can be traced back to the 17th centuary, when it belonded to a family of Gentlemen farmers called Walker. In the early 1700's most of the Hall was destroyed by fire, and was rebuilt in the Georgian style in 1746 by George Walker. The hall then passed into the hands of the Pearson family, and in the early 1800's to the Smith Family, (cont)
